4_birds.title: 4 Birds
4_birds.description: A favorite tree I see on my way to the post office, in all its Spring glory

autumnGreens.title: Autumn Greens
autumnGreens.description: The field alongside my driveway on the produce farm where I rent a house.

backYardTrees.title: Back Yard Trees
backYardTrees.description: I don’t mow my back yard very well. I don’t have neighbors.

cabinOnTheRollingRoad.title: Cabin On The Rolling Road
cabinOnTheRollingRoad.description: An authentic slave cabin which is part of historic Sotterley Plantation in Hollywood, MD.

cominBackIn.title: Coming Back In
cominBackIn.description: While enjoying lunch at waterfront Scheible’s Restaurant in Ridge, MD, these fishermen were calling it a day.

inDogWeTrust.title: In Dog we trust
inDogWeTrust.description: I couldn’t help picturing the dog just inside that opening in the siding, waiting to attack. This is at Calvert Marina in Solomons, MD

lightsOutAtTheLoma.title: Lights out at the Loma
lightsOutAtTheLoma.description: The Loma used to be a movie theater in San Diego, and was converted into a bookstore. My friend took this photo for me to use. I love neon.

newRows.title: New Rows
newRows.description: The field again - this time with Farmer Don at work on tractor.

ramonasMail.title: Ramona's Mail
ramonasMail.description: Ramona is a town in CA, and my friend had seen this row of mailboxes before and wanted to share the scene with me. Perfection!

septemberColors.title: September Colors
septemberColors.description: Another view of my driveway when the tick seed sunflowers are going crazy.

aroundTheBend.title: Around the Bend
aroundTheBend.description: St. Mary’s College of Maryland. This is the view that greets you when have reached your destination.

springtimeInBaltimore.title: Springtime in Baltimore
springtimeInBaltimore.description: Sitting at a stoplight in downtown Baltimore, I looked over to see this boy in his hand-me-down shorts and bare feet.

stopAndSlowTraffic.title: Stop and Slow Traffic
stopAndSlowTraffic.description: I thought the oncoming cars would never get there. I think this guy was ready to go home.
